title: Basic Usage
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Arrow Selection
content:
The

arrow-control property specifies whether to use the arrow to select the time. This property is valid only for <tiny-time-picker> .

title: Clear button
content: Use the clearable attribute to set whether to display the Clear button. The default value is true

title: Customized rear icon
content: uses the suffix-icon attribute to set the icon behind the date text box. An icon is imported from the @opentiny/vue-icon, initialized, and transferred to the suffix-icon.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Time Format
content:
The

format time format is displayed. timestampJS timestamp is available only in value-format. The component binding value is of the number type
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Time display type
content: You can set the 12-hour format through the hh attribute. The HH attribute is in the 24-hour format and must be used with A or a. The h and H attributes are not set to 0. You can use the mm attribute to set the minute display format, for example, 01. The m attribute is not set to 0. You can use the ss attribute to set the display format of seconds, for example, 01. The s attribute is not set to 0. The a property can be used to set the display time to am/pm A property can be used to set the display time to AM/PM.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Date Display Format
content:
The

WW attribute is set to week, for example, 01. The W attribute is set to zeros. yyyy The attribute sets the year, for example, 2020. MM: month. For example, 01 M: 0 is not added. dd attribute setting date, for example, 01 d.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Range Selection
content: is-range: indicates whether to select a range. The default value is false. range-separator. Set the range-separator (optional) to '-' by default.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Default time setting when the selector is enabled
content: Use default-value to set the selector to open the default display time
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Native Attribute
content: Set the default name through the name attribute
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Class name of the drop-down list box
content: Set the class name of the drop-down list box through the popper-class attribute
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: The text box cannot be entered.
content:
By default, you can enter a date in the

Date text box. If you set editable to false, you cannot enter a date in the

Date text box.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Event
content: When focusing or out of focus, the focus and bulr events are triggered. When the selected value is determined, the change event is triggered.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.
